A Quiet Place - Where to Stream?

Yay! The movie is available for streaming online and you can stream A Quiet Place movie on Prime Video, Netflix. However, you can also buy the movie A Quiet Place on YouTube, iTunes, Apple TV Plus, Google Play starting from Rs 460. You can also rent the movie A Quiet Place on Prime Video, YouTube, Google Play, iTunes, Apple TV Plus starting from Rs 120.

A Quiet Place - IMAGE GALLERY

STORY, RATINGS AND REVIEWS

Story
The Quite Place 2 is an amazingly anstonishing sequel of Netflix's Quite Place with alien creature who are noise sensitive, they finished almost the enite population of the Earth but still there are people who survived.
Ratings

7.5/10

IMDb

96%

Rotten Tomatoes
A Quiet Place Review

It surpassed all of my expectations. The Quite Place is not your average horror movie. It has that "engage the audience" thing. It is a science fictional apocalyptic horror movie with an amazing plot and incredible storyline. Due to the nature of the movie, there are no dialogues. This movie will not let you blink, and spectators will feel that he is in the movie. This movie is the sequel to A Quiet Place, and it's a survival movie. Here, there are horrendous creatures that are noise-sensitive . The audience will feel the same fear as the characters in this movie. This is an astonishing sequel. A Quiet Place Part 2 isn't for everyone. The gory parts and bloodshed are kept to a minimum onscreen, but it can still be very scary to some people. In my opinion, though, this movie strikes a near-perfect balance between story and scares. I guarantee you will become addicted. If you liked the first movie, the sequel is mind blowing.

TRIVIA AND POPULAR DIALOGUES

Trivia

The film's director and male lead, John Krasinski, played the creature in a motion capture suit for a few scenes.

Actress Millicent Simmonds has been deaf since infancy due to a medication overdose. This was the second film she starred in, with Wonderstruck (2017) being her first.

The filmmakers purchased twenty tons of corn and hired local farmers to grow it.

Emily Blunt did the bathtub scene in one take. According to John Krasinski, as soon as he said "Cut", Blunt left the character and asked the crew, "What's everyone having for lunch?"

Actor-director John Krasinski has said that the single greatest compliment he received regarding the film, was in a tweet from the master of the horror story himself, Stephen King: "A QUIET PLACE is an extraordinary piece of work. Terrific acting, but the main thing is the SILENCE, and how it makes the camera's eye open wide in a way few movies manage" (6 April 2018).

Popular Dialogues

"Lee Abbott: [Signed] I love you. I've always loved you."

"Marcus Abbott: You still love her, right? Lee Abbott: Of course I do. Marcus Abbott: You should tell her."
